snippet: The operator of the ravaged nuclear plant in Japan stood ready Thursday to inject boric acid into the reactor if temperature or radiation levels rose.
abstract: Damaged reactor at Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant suddenly begins releasing steam, but authorities say it does not appear to be result of renewed nuclear reactions; steam is still indicator of fragile state of plant.

byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The operator of the ravaged nuclear plant in Japan stood ready Thursday to inject boric acid into the reactor if temperature or radiation levels rose.

headline.main: Steam Detected at Damaged Fukushima Reactor
